SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Interface DatabaseListableQueryBuilder<T extends DatabaseListableQueryBuilder<T>>

All Known Implementing Classes:
DatabaseJoinedQueryBuilder, DatabaseSqlBuilder, DatabaseTableQueryBuilder
public interface DatabaseListableQueryBuilder<T extends DatabaseListableQueryBuilder<T>>
Interface to execute terminal operations for SELECT-statements. Usage: 
 table.where...().list(connection, row -> row.getUUID("column"));
 table.where...().single(connection, row -> row.getLocalDate("column"));

  • Method Details

    • orderBy

      @CheckReturnValue T orderBy(String orderByClause)
      Adds ORDER BY ... clause to the SELECT statement

    • limit

      @CheckReturnValue default T limit(int rowCount)
      Adds FETCH ... ROWS ONLY clause to the SELECT statement. FETCH FIRST was introduced in SQL:2008 and is supported by Postgresql 8.4, Oracle 12c, IBM DB2, HSQLDB, H2, and SQL Server 2012.

    • skipAndLimit

      @CheckReturnValue T skipAndLimit(int offset, int rowCount)
      Adds OFFSET ... ROWS FETCH ... ROWS ONLY clause to the SELECT statement. FETCH FIRST was introduced in SQL:2008 and is supported by Postgresql 8.4, Oracle 12c, IBM DB2, HSQLDB, H2, and SQL Server 2012.

    • singleObject

      @Nonnull @CheckReturnValue <OBJECT> SingleRow<OBJECT> singleObject(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      If the query returns no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if exactly one row is returned, maps it and return it, if more than one is returned, throws `IllegalStateException`
      Parameters:
      connection - Database connection
      mapper - Function object to map a single returned row to a object
      Returns:
      the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

    • stream

      @CheckReturnValue <OBJECT> Stream<OBJECT> stream(@Nonnull Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a stream. Example: 
           table.where("status", status).stream(connection, row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

    • list

      @CheckReturnValue default <OBJECT> List<OBJECT> list(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a list. Example: 
           List<Instant> creationTimes = table.where("status", status).list(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

    • forEach

      void forEach(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowConsumer consumer)
      Executes the SELECT * FROM ... statement and calls back to DatabaseResult.RowConsumer for each returned row

    • getCount

      @CheckReturnValue int getCount(Connection connection)
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result

    • listLongs

      @CheckReturnValue default List<Long> listLongs(Connection connection, String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result

    • listStrings

      @CheckReturnValue default List<String> listStrings(Connection connection, String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result
